mixed.output:
Sentence 1) eraser is to pencil what amnesia is to memory is a metaphor. It is comparing the relationship between an eraser and pencil to the relationship between amnesia and memory, suggesting that an eraser can completely remove what was written just as amnesia can completely remove a memory.

Sentence 3) eraser is to pencil what whiteout is to pen is anomalous. While the comparison between an eraser and whiteout is somewhat logical (both can remove what was written), the relationship between a pencil and pen is not the same. A more fitting comparison would be between an eraser and correction fluid (whiteout), or between a pencil and a mechanical pencil (which also has an eraser attached to it).
